data.title: Green chilis for breakfast?  Yes!
data.text: I had Waffles Benedito - buttermilk waffles with a green chili sauce that came with ham, spinach, avocados, or other options.  I chose avocados and received a generous portion - two big waffles, what looked like half an avocado, lots of green chili sauce, and a salad. Every mouthful of waffles was filled with crispy, smooth, spicy, and creamy, while the lightly dressed salad woke up my mouth so the next bite of waffles seemed fresh and new.  My  daughter had waffles with cherries and a goat cheese sauce and she enjoyed it very much.  We ate on the patio so our pup was welcome. Inside seating didn't allow dogs   A perfect breakfast spot!

data.title: Creative and Yummy
data.text: Came here around 12 on a weekday and got a table on the back patio. Staff were friendly, and they had a good selection of sweet, savory, and build your own waffles. I had the tostada waffle, which was absolutely massive, and I could barely eat half. I loved the blue corn waffle, and it was cooked perfectly.

data.title: Eh
data.text:
Cute place.
If you're charging more than $10 for a waffle, I'd at least expect fresh blueberries, not CANNED blueberries!!

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: The lines are long at Tia B's, but with good reason. The interior of the restaurant can feel cramped with the line waiting to order reaching out the door. There are two outdoor seating areas that help a bit and parking is a pain but the waffles are worth the wait!

data.title: Beat Waffles in NM
data.text: No matter what kind of waffle you want they have it gluten-free or not. If you're not in the mood they also have great new Mexican food. My favorite is a bacon bluecorn waffle worth 2 eggs in top

data.title: Run don't walk
data.text:
Have been to this place several times.  Each time a real joy.  The staff taking the orders are fantastic.  Nice to be greeted with smiles.  Quality and portion size are more than one can ask for.
Always busy and at times one must wait.  It's worth the wait.
On the down side.  There is a fly problem that must be addressed.  Seems they are there always.  The place is clean and am not sure what the issue is.

data.title: Waffles - YUM!
data.text: My first visit here was lovely. Kind and helpful staff, cute patio seating, and a great breakfast. The restaurant offers a variety of waffles from plain and delicious to fruity or savory. We can't wait to go back and try more.

data.title: YUMM!
data.text: This place is perfect! Cozy spot in Nob hill with authentic New Mexican twist of the BEST waffles you can find! Must try!!

data.title: Almond milk iced coffee and gluten free options
data.text:
This place is delicious! I rely on TripAdvisor for all of my travel needs! I was looking for a gluten free breakfast place and this place did not disappoint. 

I had the fried banana pancakes. So yummy and decadent. I also had an almond milk vanilla iced coffee. Heaven! 

I brought my celiac girls who ate without getting sick. One of my girls is also dairy free and she was so excited. Her plate was licked clean. One ordered the pumpkin pie waffles with blue corn and the other ordered a build your own with the coconut flour. Both were very happy with their choices. 

We went on a Tuesday so there was no wait. Friendly ladies at the front were helpful when making our choices. One of them even brought me a cookie for my birthday. 

Loved this place and would not hesitate to come back here again!!!

data.title: Forget Syrup, Try Fried Chicken!
data.text: The sky's the limit with toppings for waffles at Tia B's La Waffleria! Create your own or choose from the varied menu (breakfast waffles served all day or at least through lunch, when they close). Each waffle is made to order and brought piping hot to your table. The old house where the restaurant resides is comfy and kitchy. If your stomach can handle double carbs, splurge on a savory waffle AND a dessert waffle. Or share with a friend. Ingredients are fresh and tasty. Waffles are hot and crispy. Staff is friendly and helpful. A great lunch spot!

data.title: Brunch a bunch
data.text: Got there just before the long line... my line was at least a 10 minute wait but when I left it was out the door...  My banana whatever waffle was great as was the latte as my farewell meal in ABQ. Small inside eating area but lots of picnic tables and umbrellas outside and it was a perfect day for ala fresco dining.  Food was delivered in a timely manner even though there was a long wait to order

data.title: Good place for breakfast with friends!
data.text:
We've been here several times now and have always been impressed with the food and service. There's most often a line, but it moves fairly quickly, and we've never had a problem getting a table to fit the group we're with. 

Their coffee (particularly the blackberry mocha) is delicious, and they have teas from the New Mexico Tea Co., which is fantastic. The biscuits-and-gravy waffle is one of my favorites, though I think I might try one of the sweet ones the next time we go, because there WILL be a next time.

data.title: Holy Smokes!
data.text: This place was awesome! Great place for breakfast. It wasn't crowded at all while we were there but I can see how it could get tight. The food was exceptional. Everything that I, my wife and 2 girls had was awesome. It was fresh and rich.

data.title: Tia B's--okay, don't hold a meeting there!
data.text: Tia B's is okay--a little overpriced, not much space, and not a good place to hold any kind of a breakfast meeting where you might want to take notes or need adequate table space to do more than eat. After saving a small table, a colleague was able to grab a four person table for the three of us next to the fireplace. Our conversation and planning session of a retreat was not particularly private or all our co-eaters would have participated in it! You order at the counter--waiters bring your food. It was not particularly notable as waffles go, frankly! The last memorable waffle I ate was at Brentwood's Country Market in LA!

data.title: Best waffles in town
data.text: This great little place is a jewel.  The waffles themselves, especially the buckwheat waffles, are cooked to perfection.  The toppings are both interesting and tasty.  I love the savory combinations, but even the sweet ones are fantastic, even for someone without a sweet tooth.  Lines can be long, so try to come on a weekday!

data.title: Really really....really good
data.text: My wife and I had the dark chocolate rasberry waffle and the waffle benitos.  The rasberry waffle was really good, but the benitos was unbelievable.  The benitos is green chile breakfast heaven.  We will be back very very soon.

data.title: Surprising
data.text: This was waaaay out of my norm but went with friends from work to give it a try. I am not a sweet breakfast eater so I was skeptical to say the least about waffles for lunch. I was all set to order Chicken and Waffles and the lady at the counter said "I am so sorry, we are out of chicken" WHAT!!! I settled for smoked salmon on a buckwheat waffle. I must say I was pleasantly surprised, there was a fair amount of salmon, the dill sauce and capers pulled it all together. I can't say this would be on the regular lunch rotation but it is a definite "Gotta Try"!

data.title: Yum
data.text: Very cute restaurant and very busy. For those of us that don't like a sweet breakfast, the omelets are awesome as well.  Not a place to go if you are in a hurry - good, fresh food takes time.

data.title: Best waffles ever!
data.text: I entered the establishment and waited in a line to order. I ordered the "Bombay coconut" and a dirty chai. We sat down and enjoyed the progressive atmosphere. Those waffles were the best I've ever had! Anybody who loves a carb heavy breakfast will enjoy this place.

data.title: Who knew waffles could be so fun
data.text: Fun coffee shop vibe place in an old house with sweet and savory waffles or omelettes if you want something different.  I had the bacon and egg waffle with the bacon cooked inside. It was a fun way to eat it, two eggs on top. They have specialties or you can make your own.  Good chai too! It's my first time there, and it is December, but it looks like it has a cool front AND back patio for extra hang out space.  Not a ton of tables inside so you might have to wait for a table.
